author: RoboticBricks
title: A Fun Build & Great Promo
review:
This build was only available in North American LEGO Stores (July 2017) as a promotion after spending a certain amount of money (I believe it was $75 or more). It was supposed to be adults (18+) only and I found that my "local" LEGO store stuck to that policy.

The Build

The build was fairly straight forward and the pieces were already laid out, so no reaching over others trying to grab parts. Despite this being a "free" build, it had the same feeling as building a regular Brickhead— the LEGO group wasn't ripping anyone off with this. The instructions were printed on regular printer paper and were easy to follow.

The Finished Product

The finished build looks very good but lacks printed elements. They could have even included stickers that would've made this build much more recognizable and accurate. I also feel disappointed they didn't include a printed tile (or sticker) on the base. Although I understand how this could be beneficial to anyone who didn't attend as they could build it without the worry of exclusive pieces/prints.

Overall

All in all, this build gets 5 stars from me given that it was free and that I had a very pleasant building experience.
